intro: Trichelostylis scabra, commonly known as the rough-leaved trichelostylis, is a species of flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, rough-textured leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as rainforests and along stream banks. Trichelostylis scabra is often found in the understorey of dense vegetation, where it forms a low, compact shrub.
